intro: Pleurothallis ciliolata, commonly known as the velvet orchid, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, often clustered in a raceme. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, acidic soil. Due to its unique appearance and relatively easy care, it is a popular choice for orchid enthusiasts.
